The Great Fifty
Fourth Section🔽Discussion of whether one who is a lay follower is a perfected one
“Is one who is a lay follower a perfected one?”
“Yes.”
“Is there a lay follower’s fetter in a perfected one?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is there no lay follower’s fetter in a perfected one?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci natthi arahato gihisaṁyojanaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci natthi arahataḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then it is not correct to say that there is no lay follower’s fetter in a perfected one, but that one who is a lay follower is a perfected one.”
“Is one who is a lay follower a perfected one?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu arahato gihisaṁyojanaṁ pahīnaṁ ucchinnamūlaṁ tālāvatthukataṁ anabhāvaṅkataṁ āyatiṁ anuppādadhammanti?
analyzed: nanu arahataḥ gihi sayojanam pahīnam ucchinna mūlam tālāvatthukatam anabhāvaṅkatam āyatim an uppāda dhammanti
translated: “Isn’t it the case that a lay follower’s fetter is abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that it is no more subject to future arising?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci arahato gihisaṁyojanaṁ pahīnaṁ ucchinnamūlaṁ tālāvatthukataṁ anabhāvaṅkataṁ āyatiṁ anuppādadhammaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“gihi’ssa arahā”ti.
analyzed: hañci arahataḥ gihi sayojanam pahīnam ucchinna mūlam tālāvatthukatam anabhāvaṅkatam āyatim an uppāda dhamma no ca vata re vattabbe  gihissa arahāti
translated: “Then it is not correct to say that a lay follower’s fetter is abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that it is no more subject to future arising, but that one who is a lay follower is a perfected one.”
“Is one who is a lay follower a perfected one?”
“Yes.”
